p: Outbreaks of infection can be devastating for individuals and societies. In medieval times, the Black Death led to the death of up to a third of the inhabitants of Europe [ 1]. More recently, an outbreak of Shiga-toxin-producing Escherichia coli (STEC) struck Germany in May-June 2011, resulting in over 3,000 cases and over 50 deaths, and provided ample evidence of the harrowing effects of bacterial infection on a modern, industrialized society [ 2, 3].
